app.services.users module¶

class app.services.users.UserServices(db)¶

Bases: object

activate_user(data: UserActivation)¶
The activate_user function is used to activate a user.
post:

description: Activate a user by providing the OTP sent to their email address. requestBody: # This is where you define the payload of your request body, if any. If there’s no payload, omit this section entirely!

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of the class

  • data – UserActivation: Pass the data to the function

Returns:

The user object

Doc-author:

Trelent

create_new(user: User) → User¶
The create_new function creates a new user in the database.
Args:

self (UserRepo): The UserRepo object that is calling this function. user (User): A User object to be created in the database.

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of the class

  • user – User: Pass the user object to the function

Returns:

A new user

Doc-author:

Trelent

get_by_username(username: str) → User¶

The get_by_username function takes in a username and returns the user object associated with that username. If no such user exists, it raises an HTTPException.

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of the class

  • username – str: Specify the type of data that is expected to be passed into the function

Returns:

A user object

Doc-author:

Trelent

get_user_for_auth(username: str, password: str) → User¶

The get_user_for_auth function is used to authenticate a user. It takes in the username and password of the user, and returns a User object if authentication was successful. If authentication fails, it raises an HTTPException with status code 403.

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of a class

  • username – str: Get the username from the request body,

  • password – str: Check the password against the user’s hashed password

Returns:

A user object

Doc-author:

Trelent

set_image(user: User, url: str) → User¶

The set_image function takes in a user and an image url. It then sets the user’s image to the given url, updates it in the database, and returns a User object with all of its attributes.

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of a class

  • user – User: Pass in the user object to be updated

  • url – str: Set the image url for a user

Returns:

A user object

Doc-author:

Trelent
